bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Illness Sign of red, purple or in severe cases even black macules developing on the skin. When the dots are large they may develop flakes. In general, though, when stroking the afflicted dermal region one does not feel an elevation. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 8: 體 如被打，發斑，此皆其候 , “The body looks as if beaten and develops macules . All these [conditions] are its signs”.

a) of the development of macules. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 9: 凡發斑不可用發表藥，令 瘡開泄，更增斑爛，表虛故也 , “Whenever macules appear one must not use pharmaceutical substances to open up the exterior. They would cause the sores to open and discharge liquid, and the festering of the macules would be further increased because of a depletion in the exterior”.

b) identical with dou chuang 痘瘡 , smallpox sores. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 18: 治熱病斑發，須臾遍身，皆戴白漿 , “To cure heat disease with the appearance of macules . After a short while they cover the entire body, with all of them containing a thick, white liquid.”.
